intro: Lycianthes lucens, commonly known as the silverleaf nightshade, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes tomatoes, potatoes, and tobacco. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with hairy, lance-shaped leaves and small, yellowish-white flowers. Its fruits are berries that turn from green to red as they mature. The species is characterized by its silver-gray foliage, which gives it its common name.
